newsitem.title: CROATIA: US plans credit line for Croatian enterprises.
newsitem.headline: US plans credit line for Croatian enterprises.

text.p: The United States plans credit lines of up to $10,000 to develop small businesses in eastern Croatia, part of which is a Serb enclave under temporary U.N. administration, the U.S. Embassy said on Friday.

It said the Agency for International Development (USAID) had granted $3 million for a project of helping private entrepreneurs who cannot get bank loans in Croatia, where interest rates are very high.
An office for the project will open on Monday in Osijek.

"The aim ... is to support the development of small companies in all of Slavonia, including parts which are currently administered by the United Nations," said an embassy statement faxed to news agencies.
Eastern Slavonia, seized by separatist minority Serbs in 1991, is due to be transferred under U.N. supervision back to Croatian government control next year.
